featured.text: Before Moran arrived, Yellowstone in the popular imagination was a harsh, wild place with hot water and steam coming out of hellish holes in the ground.
In 1871 Moran joined the first US government survey of the Yellowstone region with photographer William Henry Jackson.
In March 1872, lawmakers officially made Yellowstone a national park, the world’s first.
Since the painter’s work appeared, Yellowstone National Park has come to be known as a picturesque wonderland.

other.text: His powerful images of Yellowstone fired the imagination of Congress members.
In 1871, he was appointed to illustrate The Wonders of Yellowstone, a story by Nathaniel P. Langford, who had participated in an expedition to Yellowstone.
Which of the following statements is true about the Yellowstone National Park?
How Yellowstone’s natural features were formed.

definition.zh_def: 黃石國家公園，位於美國，是世界上第一個國家公園，以其地熱特徵和豐富的野生動物而聞名。
definition.en_def: Yellowstone is a national park in the United States, known for its geothermal features and diverse wildlife, and it was the first national park in the world.
definition.example: Yellowstone National Park is famous for its stunning geysers and beautiful landscapes.
